DOC.brief_summary: The main objective study ass effectiveness sheathe speculum provide adequate visualization access cervix patient excessive vaginal tissue . The secondary objective rate patient 's comfort evaluation sheathe speculum examination .
DOC.brief_title: Using Sheathed Speculum Visualize Access Cervix In Women With Excessive Vaginal Tissue
DOC.detailed_description: This descriptive clinical trial design assess efficacy sheathe speculum provide adequate visualization access cervix woman excessive vaginal tissue . Eligible , consented subject fail initial speculum examination ( cervix visualize due collapse loose lateral vaginal wall ) sheathe speculum examination instead standard-of-care exam whereby clinician fabricate solution bedside ( condom tip cut place speculum , concomitantly use additional instrument like lateral-wall retractor , glove tip thumb place speculum , use large speculum available )
DOC.criteria: Age 18 64 year BMI great 30 ( see next line ) Collapsing vaginal tissue prevent visualization cervix ( meet criterion absence BMI > 30 would also qualify patient study ) . Able provide write informed consent Patients unwilling participate study provide consent Presence significant acute pelvic pain syndrome ( ie exacerbation dyspareunia , chronic pelvic pain pelvic floor dysfunction , atrophic vaginitis , interstitial cystitis , endometriosis ) , opinion examine clinician , could potentially confound patient 's response questionnaire Presence active genital herpes Presence significant condyloma acuminata ( may investigator decision ) Any patient deem inappropriate study consent examine investigator .
